author: arnetheduck
content: we're iterating over the `.era` file support in nimbus which could be more generally useful as a long-term archival format for beacon chain data - with the merge coming up, `.era` files would conveniently _also_ cover execution data - I have some half-baked plans to turn this into an EIP at some point but early feedback welcome: https://github.com/status-im/nimbus-eth2/blob/era-files-update/docs/e2store.md#era-files - era files have a few nice properties - in particular, they're trivial to read, write and distribute out-of-band (torrent etc) - they also serve as a backing store for `GetBlocksByRange` requests etc, so clients can trivially fulfil their duties from read-only / slow storage for finalised data, kickstart a checkpoint sync without backfilling etc - the naming ties in with state data, again making it easier to distribute out-of-band - take a look! to date, we've produced ~330 eras that take up `29gb` of space - this includes all the blocks since genesis, along with a single state per era.

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Will it contain blocks and receipts post merge or only execution blocks?

author: arnetheduck
content: that would be an excellent point to discuss - ie in the shape it has right now, it would target anything that's been finalized on the beacon chain - that includes the execution data of the beacon chain blocks

author: arnetheduck
content: the format is a very classic TLV file, meaning we can put other things in there in the future - what's specified right now is the CL `BeaconBlock` and `BeaconState`

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: This is a state test, which is the common format for testing changes to the EVM. You can use it to verify that you implemented 4399 correctly. But you need to change the way state tests are consumed a bit. The changes needed for geth to execute it are here: https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/pull/24141
